info.description: These APIs are for Payroll Interface. Using these APIs, Payroll Interface Administrators and Payroll Interface Partners can view and maintain payroll inputs through the Worker and Batch APIs.
info.title: Global Payroll (Labs)

get.description: Retrieves a collection of Payroll Interface pay components, sorted by name in ascending alphabetical order. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll Interface. Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: usage
parameters.description: The pay component usage type.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

schema.description: A collection of Payroll Interface pay components

get.description: Retrieves a Payroll Interface pay component for the specified {ID}. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll Interface. Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID or reference ID of the pay component. The reference ID uses the <Deduction_Code>=<id> format for deductions and <Earning_Code>=<=id> for earnings; example: Deduction_Code=Deduction1, Earning_Code=Earning1. The value of the Workday ID can be found in the list of pay components from the response of an API request to /payComponents. The value of the reference ID is the same as the pay component code, which can be found in the View External Payroll Deductions or View External Payroll Earnings report.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of Payroll Interface workers, sorted by name in ascending alphabetical order. Secured by: Worker Data: Payroll Interface (Payroll Input by Worker). Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

schema.description: A collection of Payroll Interface worker objects

get.description: Retrieves a Payroll Interface worker for the specified {ID}. Secured by: Worker Data: Payroll Interface (Payroll Input by Worker). Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker. This value can be found in the list of workers from the response of an API request to /workers.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of Payroll Interface payroll inputs for the worker specified by {ID}. Secured by: Worker Data: Payroll Interface (Payroll Input by Worker). Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: batchId
parameters.description: The Workday ID or reference ID of the batch for the payroll input. The reference ID uses the <Batch_ID>=<id> format; example: Batch_ID=1234. The value of the Workday ID can be found in the list of batches from the response of an API request to /batches. The value of the reference ID is the same as the batch ID, which is displayed in the "descriptor" field of the response of an API request to /batches.

parameters.name: component
parameters.description: The Workday ID or reference ID of the Payroll Interface pay component for the payroll input. The reference ID uses the <Deduction_Code>=<id> format for deductions and <Earning_Code>=<=id> for earnings; example: Deduction_Code=Deduction1, Earning_Code-Earning1. The value of the Workday ID can be found in the list of pay components from the response of an API request to /payComponents. The value of the reference ID is the same as the pay component code, which can be found in the View External Payroll Deductions or View External Payroll Earnings report.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date of the payroll input using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date of the payroll input using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker. This value can be found in the list of workers from the response of an API request to /workers.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

schema.description: A collection of Payroll Interface payroll inputs

post.description: Create one or multiple (up to 100) Payroll Interface payroll inputs for the specified worker. Secured by: Worker Data: Payroll Interface (Payroll Input by Worker). Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker. This value can be found in the list of workers from the response of an API request to /workers.

parameters.name: bulk
parameters.description: If true, this enables bulk creation.

400.description: Invalid request. Possible error(s): An invalid Payroll Interface pay component was provided.

get.description: Retrieves a Payroll Interface payroll input for the specified {subresourceID} for the worker specified by {ID}. Secured by: Worker Data: Payroll Interface (Payroll Input by Worker). Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker. This value can be found in the list of workers from the response of an API request to /workers.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the payroll input. This can be found in the list of payroll inputs from the response of an API request to /workers/{ID}/externalInputs.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

patch.description: Updates one or multiple (up to 100) Payroll Interface payroll inputs for the worker specified by {ID}. Partially updates the existing payroll input with the specified data in the request body. Secured by: Worker Data: Payroll Interface (Payroll Input by Worker). Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker. This value can be found in the list of workers from the response of an API request to /workers.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the payroll input. This can be found in the list of payroll inputs from the response of an API request to /workers/{ID}/externalInputs.

parameters.name: bulk
parameters.description: If true, this enables bulk update.

400.description: Invalid request. Possible error(s): An invalid Payroll Interface pay component was provided.

delete.description: Deletes a Payroll Interface payroll input for the specified {subresourceID} for the worker specified by {ID}. Secured by: Worker Data: Payroll Interface (Payroll Input by Worker). Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker. This value can be found in the list of workers from the response of an API request to /workers.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the payroll input. This can be found in the list of payroll inputs from the response of an API request to /workers/{ID}/externalInputs.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of batches, sorted by batch ID in ascending alphabetical order. Secured by: REST API Public. Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: usage
parameters.description: The Workday ID or reference ID of the batch usage. The reference ID uses the <Application_Batch_Usage_ID>=<id> format; example: Batch_ID=PAYROLL_INTERFACE. See the available values listed.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves a batch for the specified {ID}. Secured by: REST API Public. Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID or reference ID of the batch. The reference ID uses the <Batch_ID>=<id> format; example: Batch_ID=1234. The value of the Workday ID can be found in the list of batches from the response of an API request to /batches. The value of the reference ID is the same as the batch ID, which is displayed in the "descriptor" field of the response of an API request to /batches.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

delete.description: Deletes all payroll inputs associated with the batch, along with the batch ID. Secured by: Process: Delete External Payroll Input by Batch ID - batch. Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID or reference ID of the batch. The reference ID uses the <Batch_ID>=<id> format; example: Batch_ID=1234. The value of the Workday ID can be found in the list of batches from the response of an API request to /batches. The value of the reference ID is the same as the batch ID, which is displayed in the "descriptor" field of the response of an API request to /batches.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of resource to delete. A batch can apply to different resources.

200.description: Resources (batch and related payroll input instance(s)) deleted.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of Payroll Interface payroll inputs for the batch specified by {ID}. Secured by: Worker Data: Payroll Interface (Payroll Input by Worker). Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date of the payroll input using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: endDate

parameters.name: component
parameters.description: The Workday ID or reference ID of the pay component for the payroll input. The reference ID uses the <Deduction_Code>=<id> format for deductions and <Earning_Code>=<=id> for earnings; example: Deduction_Code=Deduction1, Earning_Code-Earning1. The value of the Workday ID can be found in the list of pay components from the response of an API request to /payComponents. The value of the reference ID is the same as the pay component code, which can be found in the View External Payroll Deductions or View External Payroll Earnings report.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID or reference ID of the batch. The reference ID uses the <Batch_ID>=<id> format; example: Batch_ID=1234. The value of the Workday ID can be found in the list of batches from the response of an API request to /batches. The value of the reference ID is the same as the batch ID, which is displayed in the "descriptor" field of the response of an API request to /batches.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

schema.description: A collection of Payroll Interace payroll inputs

post.description: Create one or multiple (up to 100) Payroll Interface payroll inputs for the batch specified by {ID}. Secured by: Worker Data: Payroll Interface (Payroll Input by Worker). Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID or reference ID of the batch. The reference ID uses the <Batch_ID>=<id> format; example: Batch_ID=1234. The value of the Workday ID can be found in the list of batches from the response of an API request to /batches. The value of the reference ID is the same as the batch ID, which is displayed in the "descriptor" field of the response of an API request to /batches.

parameters.name: bulk
parameters.description: If true, this enables bulk creation.

get.description: Retrieves a Payroll Interface payroll input for the specified {subresourceID} for the batch specified by {ID}. Secured by: Worker Data: Payroll Interface (Payroll Input by Worker). Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID or reference ID of the batch. The reference ID uses the <Batch_ID>=<id> format; example: Batch_ID=1234. The value of the Workday ID can be found in the list of batches from the response of an API request to /batches. The value of the reference ID is the same as the batch ID, which is displayed in the "descriptor" field of the response of an API request to /batches.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: ID of specified payroll input instance. This can be found in the list of payroll inputs from the response of an API request to /batches/{ID}/externalInputs.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

patch.description: Updates one or multiple (up to 100) Payroll Interface payroll inputs for the batch specified by {ID}. Partially updates the existing payroll input with the specified data in the request body. Secured by: Worker Data: Payroll Interface (Payroll Input by Worker). Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID or reference ID of the batch. The reference ID uses the <Batch_ID>=<id> format; example: Batch_ID=1234. The value of the Workday ID can be found in the list of batches from the response of an API request to /batches. The value of the reference ID is the same as the batch ID, which is displayed in the "descriptor" field of the response of an API request to /batches.

parameters.name: bulk
parameters.description: If true, this enables bulk update.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: ID of specified payroll input instance. This can be found in the list of payroll inputs from the response of an API request to /batches/{ID}/externalInputs.

descriptor.description: The name of the Payroll Interface pay component
The payroll input name, which contains payroll input details

value.description: Input goal amount for pay component.
